result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Waldow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.   
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Joshua J. Waldow, appeared with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowlegement given.
Sentencing hearing on December 12, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing rescheduled to 12/12 at 11:00 AM per confirmation with Atty Lassiter.
Court has reviewed and approves request for adjournment with no objection by the State.  Sentencing adj. to 12/12/14 at 11:00 AM pending confirmation from Atty Lassiter.
Email correspondence received from Atty Lassiter requesting to adjourn sentencing on 10/30/14 as she will be stuck in another court at that time.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Joshua J. Waldow, appeared with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 10/30/14 at 10:30 AM.

Attorney Patrick Anderson appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Atty Lassiter states they are attempting to get a counter offer from DA Zapf and requests an adjournment; no objection by the State.  FPT adj. to 9/16/14 at 11:30 AM.

Defendant, Joshua J. Waldow, appeared with Attorney Carmen L Lassiter.  Attorney Jason R Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Def. has picked up new felony charges, 14CF680, w/prelim hrg on 7/3.  Parties request this matter be set over so the cases can be heard together.  Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Carmen Lassiter. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-19-14 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
Atty Carmen Lassiter
filed by Atty Lassiter

217 p.m.  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 4/25/14 @ 9 a.m. $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ parking lot at 1207 60th Street.
